2.text: “How long will you speak these things? Shall the words of your mouth be a mighty wind?

3.text: Does God pervert justice? Or does the Almighty pervert righteousness?

4.text: If your children have sinned against him, He has delivered them into the hand of their disobedience.

5.text: If you want to seek God diligently, make your supplication to the Almighty.

6.text: If you were pure and upright, surely now he would awaken for you, and make the habitation of your righteousness prosperous.

7.text: Though your beginning was small, yet your latter end would greatly increase.

8.text: “Please inquire of past generations. Find out about the learning of their fathers.

9.text: (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days on earth are a shadow.)

10.text: Shall they not teach you, tell you, and utter words out of their heart?

11.text: “Can the papyrus grow up without mire? Can the rushes grow without water?

12.text: While it is yet in its greenness, not cut down, it withers before any other reed.

13.text: So are the paths of all who forget God. The hope of the godless man shall perish,

14.text: Whose confidence shall break apart, Whose trust is a spider’s web.

15.text: He shall lean on his house, but it shall not stand. He shall cling to it, but it shall not endure.

16.text: He is green before the sun. His shoots go forth over his garden.

17.text: His roots are wrapped around the rock pile. He sees the place of stones.

18.text: If he is destroyed from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, ‘I have not seen you.’

19.text: Behold, this is the joy of his way: out of the earth, others shall spring.

20.text: “Behold, God will not cast away a blameless man, neither will he uphold the evildoers.

21.text: He will still fill your mouth with laughter, your lips with shouting.

22.text: Those who hate you shall be clothed with shame. The tent of the wicked shall be no more.”
